name: starter - is a good app
description: starter is a react native cross platform app

________comments________.name: Long name of app (e.g. on splash screen)
________comments________.short_name: Short name of app (e.g. below icon)
________comments________.start_url: Which page to load on startup
________comments________.scope: Which pages are included in 'PWA Experience'
________comments________.display: How app look like (modes: fullscreen, standalone(default), minimal-ui, browser)
________comments________.background_color: Background whilst loading & on splash screen
________comments________.theme_color: Theme color (e.g. on top bar in task switcher)
________comments________.description: Description (e.g. when user add page as favorite)
________comments________.dir: Read direction of your app (modes: auto, ltr, rtl)
________comments________.orientation: Set (and enforce) default orientation of app (modes: any, natural, landscape, landscape-primary, landscape-secondary, portrait, portrait-primary, portrait-secondary)
________comments________.icons: Configures icons (e.g. app icon on home screen) ; you can use https://www.favicon-generator.org/ to generate icons
________comments________.categories: Categories of app, Used as hints for catalogs or stores listing web applications (e.g books, education, medical)
________comments________.prefer_related_applications: Is a boolean value that specifies that applications listed in related_applications should be preferred over the web application. If the prefer_related_applications member is set to true, the user agent might suggest installing one of the related applications instead of this web app.
________comments________.related_applications: Is an array of objects specifying native applications that are installable by, or accessible to, the underlying platform â€” for example, a native Android application equivalent.
________comments________.screenshots: Defines an array of screenshots intended to showcase the application. These images are intended to be used by progressive web app stores.
________comments________.serviceworker: Describes a service worker that the developer intends to install to control the PWA.
